#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Interview
#Text=Prior to your involvement in the Beck v. Eiland-Hall case , what related legal experience have you had specifically related to the legal concepts of the case ?
#Text=I am both a First Amendment lawyer and an intellectual property lawyer .
#Text=I practice in these areas , write on those areas , and taught them at the law school level .
#Text=Given that these are my areas of expertise , this case was directly in my strike zone .
#Text=Why did you agree to represent Isaac Eiland-Hall ?
#Text=What interested you about the case ?
#Text=When one citizen 's constitutional rights are threatened , all of our rights are threatened , and I 'm not letting that happen on my watch . — Marc Randazza
#Text=I took this case because of my sense of patriotism demanded it , as did my feelings about maintaining good karma .
#Text=I became a First Amendment lawyer because I believe deeply in the Constitution .

#Text=As my career has gone on , I 've seen that often wealthy and powerful people are awfully thin skinned about criticism , and they use their money and power to attempt to silence " the little guy . "
#Text=However , when that happens , the guy who gets pushed around suffers , but so do all of us .
#Text=When one citizen 's constitutional rights are threatened , all of our rights are threatened , and I 'm not letting that happen on my watch .
#Text=Isaac was being bullied , he was worried , and he could n't afford a lawyer .
#Text=After we spoke , he seemed like the kind of client I would be proud to represent , so I agreed to handle his case .
#Text=In your response brief in the Beck v. Eiland-Hall case , you wrote , " Mr. Beck has all but begged to become the subject of a meme . "
#Text=Are you familiar with the concept of the term the " Streisand effect " ?

column1: #Text=How do you think the Streisand effect applies to this case and to Glenn Beck 's situation with regard to the Internet meme , and the website ?
#Text=The one thing that breathed life into this meme was Mr. Beck 's reaction to it . — Marc Randazza
#Text=I am familiar with that concept .
#Text=This case clearly proved that the effect exists and should be treated as a law of nature .
#Text=Had Mr. Beck simply ignored this meme , it likely would have died out .
#Text=Most internet memes die quickly .
#Text=The one thing that breathed life into this meme was Mr. Beck 's reaction to it .

#Text=You wrote in the conclusion to the Eiland-Hall response brief , " there can be only one purpose to filing this complaint : as an attempt to silence a critic because he does n't like being criticized . "
#Text=Can you explain your argument that Beck 's legal actions are intended only to silence criticism ?
